attributes.action: The Government has to STOP the ULEZ expansion and scrap the ULEZ parts present.
attributes.additional_details: Even though England is an HIC the country still has many people who gain very little money leading them to afford old cars and when we have to pay £12.50 a day on top of that to drive the car is incredible. with the cost of living going up the resources for the car such as petrol is very expensive. your doing this because you want to keep the air safe. if you really cared you would stop polluting cars outright. Charging Money is not going to solve the problem. Help the poor and save air properly
attributes.background: Halting ULEZ Zone expansion. Charging £12.50/day for non-compliant vehicles is unfair, especially for those hit hard by Covid. If genuine about air quality, ban polluting vehicles outright. Charging money without a real impact won't solve the pollution problem. Act responsibly; prioritise clean air

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Remove local authority powers to introduce LTNs, CAZs, LEZs and ULEZs: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/637517
